stimulusHtml: Let y = f(x) define a twice-differentiable function and let y = t(x) be the line tangent to the graph of f at x = 2. If t(x) ≥ f(x) for all real x, which of the following must be true?
choicesHtml: f( 2 )≥0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BE3@

f ′ ( 2 )≥0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BEF@

f ′ ( 2 )≤0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BDE@

f ″ ( 2 )≥0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BF0@

f ″ ( 2 )≤0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BDF@
